messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I just called over to my sister's house and my nephew, who is a felon, is causing problems there. My brother-in-law had to take my sister out of the house. I need someone to go there, please.
Okay. Can you tell me more about what’s happening?
He just hung up on me and called me a bitch. There’s a bunch of drinking going on. My nephew is on house arrest with an ankle bracelet. He ran my sister and her husband out of the house.
So, you're calling to report that there's drinking and he's causing a disturbance?
Yes, he's almost 30 years old and there’s some violence going on.
Okay. Why isn't your sister calling us directly?
Her husband took her out because Jay is violent. They’re scared of him.
I understand. He's on house arrest and drinking?
Yes, and he's out of control. My sister and her husband had to leave the house because of him.
Alright, but we need your sister or someone in the house to call us directly.
She called me, saying she's scared. I don’t know what you want us to do.
If he's violent and causing a disturbance right now, we can send someone over to check.
He’s doing meth and other stuff. My sister's scared to death.
Is there anyone currently in the house who can talk to us?
I don’t know, but you need to go over there. He just hung up on me.
Hanging up on you isn’t illegal, but we'll send someone to check if there’s a problem.
Thank you. I just thought you guys would do something.
We’re on our way to check it out.
Thanks a lot. I hope this helps.
You're welcome. If your sister needs further assistance, she should call us directly.
Alright, I will let her know.
